newsitem.title: USA: Anergen gets fee from Akzo unit.
newsitem.headline: Anergen gets fee from Akzo unit.

text.p: Anergen Inc said on Wednesday it had received a $2 million license fee from the Netherlands' N.V. Organon, a unit of chemicals group Akzo Nobel NV, for Anergen's AnergiX technology for the development of a new therapeutic for rheumatoid arthritis.

On June 28, Anergen announced the signing of an agreement with Organon to develop a product to treat rheumatoid arthritis by utilizing a peptide discovered by Organon with Anergen's proprietary technology. AnergiX compounds comprise an MHC-derived protein complexed with a disease-specific auto-antigenic peptide.
"This license fee represents the initiation of our relationship with Organon ..." said Dr. Barry M. Sherman, president and chief executive of Anergen.
